comment_data.body:
This is due to https://bugs.python.org/issue23545 which IMHO was a mistake.

It's a perfectly accepted thing to write non-trivial unreachable code (depending on the system, different branches are unreachable) like in the code that you quoted in the issue description.

If you don't like the warnings, compile with `-Wno-unreachable-code`.
You don't provide enough context, but my guess is that whether this code is "unreachable" depends on the (unknown) relative size of the various ints, so we can't avoid it.

title: Mac: lots of warnings "will never be executed" with Python 3.6.0
